name: Publicis Groupe
title: CoreAI Platform — Hub-and-Spoke with Agentic AI

classification.classificationRationale: Reclassified from M2 (CoE) to M4 (Hub-and-Spoke). CoreAI is the hub — an in-house AI foundation built by Publicis Sapient that unifies 2.3B consumer profiles with trillions of data points. Media, creative, and technology practices are spokes. 73% of operating model now 'AI-powered.' CEO Sadoun explicitly describes CoreAI as connecting all competitive advantages at scale. Multi-model AI vendor strategy (refused to wed to single vendor, unlike WPP/Gemini). Structural orientation: CoreAI is a named, formally-structured platform with dedicated technical core (Publicis Sapient).

description:
Publicis Groupe has built CoreAI, an in-house AI foundation developed by Publicis Sapient that unifies 2.3 billion consumer profiles with trillions of data points. 73% of the operating model is now described as 'AI-powered,' with agentic AI applications connecting media, creative, data, and technology capabilities at scale.

The CoreAI platform serves as the hub in a hub-and-spoke arrangement: Publicis Sapient is the technical core building and maintaining the platform; media, creative, and technology practices are spokes that leverage CoreAI for client delivery. CEO Arthur Sadoun explicitly positions this as the company's structural differentiator, stating that only Publicis can connect all four competitive advantages through CoreAI's agentic applications.

Notably, Sadoun has explicitly rejected single-vendor AI dependency ('We are not an AI platform, and we shouldn't compete with those investing trillions into data and new technology'), distinguishing Publicis from WPP's exclusive Gemini deal. The company also created an AI Center of Excellence and 'Enterprise AI Factories' in partnership with NVIDIA, with Publicis Sapient launching 'AI Factory Solutions' for client-facing AI lifecycle management.

FY2025 revenue reached €17.4B (+8.5% reported, +5.6% organic), with operating margin of 18.2% — agentic solutions described as 'taking labor-intensive tasks and creating incremental leverage.'

observableMarkers.reportingStructure: CoreAI built by Publicis Sapient (tech consulting arm). CEO Arthur Sadoun leads overall AI strategy.
observableMarkers.resourceAllocation: NVIDIA Enterprise AI Factories partnership. Multi-model AI vendor strategy.
observableMarkers.decisionRights: Hub (CoreAI/Publicis Sapient) sets AI standards; spokes (media, creative, tech practices) execute at client sites.
observableMarkers.metrics: €17.4B revenue (+8.5%). 18.2% operating margin. 73% of operating model AI-powered. 2.3B consumer profiles unified. +5.6% organic growth.

quotes.text: What truly makes Publicis a category of one is that only we, thanks to CoreAI agentic applications, connect all four of those competitive advantages at scale.
quotes.speaker: Arthur Sadoun

quotes.text: We are not an AI platform, and we shouldn't compete with those investing trillions into data and new technology.
quotes.speaker: Arthur Sadoun

openQuestions: How large is the dedicated CoreAI/Publicis Sapient AI team?
How does CoreAI's multi-vendor strategy work in practice — which models for which tasks?
What is the internal governance structure of CoreAI? Who decides model selection, data access?
How does the 73% 'AI-powered' claim translate to actual structural changes in team composition?
What is the NVIDIA Enterprise AI Factories partnership delivering specifically?
taxonomyFeedback: Reclassified from M2 to M4. CoreAI is a platform hub, not a standalone CoE. Publicis Sapient builds it; practices consume it. The 73% AI-powered operating model claim suggests deep integration beyond a CoE advisory function.
Sadoun's explicit rejection of single-vendor AI dependency is a structural governance choice worth tracking as a pattern. Contrast with WPP's exclusive Gemini deal.
Advertising/media industry remains underrepresented in the collection. Publicis and Stagwell are the only ad industry specimens.
